issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: I have used these functions in other artifacts like {{turbodbc}}. I would like to have them back as part of libarrow.
fields.summary: [C++] test-util functions are no longer part of libarrow

comments.body: [~wesmckinn] [~pitrou] Was the removal of them an intended change?
I'm not sure it was. Do you know when it happened?

[~wesmckinn] made the change in https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/7cdab9b06541617ea67ee2ae1694195b8281125a I'm happy to take care of moving this back to {{libarrow}} when there is no disagreement.
If you manage to do it without breaking Windows builds then I don't think there'll be a disagreement.
Which functions do you need? We can't have a gtest dependency in libarrow; so as long as you don't move over code that depends on gtest it is OK
What do you think about installing {{arrow_testing.so}} instead?
These functions I want to use are all independent of gtest. Thus I would rather link them into libarrow then starting a new lib.

Sounds good to me. Why don't we create a {{src/arrow/testing}} directory where we can organize our testing code used throughout the project. We can maintain a clean separate between the stuff that depends on gtest and what doesn't
Are you able to submit a patch for this?
Yes, working on that next week
